services.name: AI-Powered Speaker Coach
services.overview: The AI-Powered Speaker Coach is a real-time feedback and guidance system designed to enhance speaker performance during webinars, presentations, and online training sessions. By leveraging advanced NLP and audio analysis, the system provides instant insights into pacing, clarity, and audience engagement. This service addresses the critical need for consistent speaker quality, which directly impacts audience retention, comprehension, and overall webinar effectiveness. The Speaker Coach aims to empower presenters with actionable feedback, fostering continuous improvement and ultimately leading to more impactful and successful online events.
problems_addressed: Inconsistent speaker quality leading to disengaged audiences.
Difficulty for speakers to self-monitor pacing and clarity in real-time.
Lack of objective feedback on speaker performance for continuous improvement.
core_features: Real-time Pacing Analysis – Analyzes speech rate and provides immediate feedback to speakers who are speaking too fast or too slow, ensuring optimal comprehension.
Filler Word Detection – Identifies and highlights the use of filler words ('um', 'ah', 'like') in real-time, helping speakers become more aware and reduce their usage.
Clarity Score – Assesses the clarity of speech based on articulation and pronunciation, offering tips for improvement.
Eye Contact Monitoring – (If video feed is available) Analyzes eye contact patterns and alerts speakers to look at the camera more often to enhance engagement.
Sentiment Analysis – Detects the emotional tone of the speaker and the audience's reactions (if audience interaction is enabled), providing insights into how the message is being received.

Post-Webinar Performance Report – Generates a comprehensive report summarizing speaker performance, highlighting areas of strength and areas needing improvement, with specific recommendations for future presentations.
Customizable Feedback Sensitivity - Allows users to adjust the sensitivity of the feedback system, tailoring it to their individual preferences and skill levels.
user_journeys: A sales representative joins a product demo webinar. Upon connecting to the platform, the AI Speaker Coach activates. Throughout the demo, the AI provides real-time feedback on their pacing, notifying them when they speak too quickly.  It also detects excessive use of filler words, prompting them to be more concise.  After the webinar, the sales representative receives a detailed report with specific areas for improvement, such as focusing on key features and maintaining a consistent speaking pace. The rep uses this feedback to refine their presentation style for future demos.
ai_capabilities: Speech-to-text conversion using OpenAI's Whisper model for real-time audio transcription.
NLP analysis using a fine-tuned BERT model for sentiment analysis of both the speaker and audience (if available through chat or reactions).
Custom ML model to detect filler words based on audio analysis, trained on a dataset of various speech patterns and filler word usage.
Computer Vision model (using OpenCV or similar libraries) to analyze eye contact based on the speaker's video feed.
Pacing analysis based on word count per minute, with dynamic threshold adjustment based on content complexity.

input_data_types: Audio stream from the speaker's microphone.
Optional: Video stream from the speaker's camera.
Optional: Audience interaction data (chat messages, reactions).
data_schema_recommendations: No specific DB schema needed for real-time analysis. For post-webinar reports, a simple key-value store can be used to store performance metrics (e.g., speaker_id, webinar_id, pacing_score, filler_word_count, sentiment_score).
data_sources: Speaker's microphone and camera (accessed via browser APIs or native application SDKs).
Webinar platform's chat API or event stream for audience interaction data.
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other relevant privacy regulations. Implement data anonymization techniques where necessary, especially when processing audience interaction data. Obtain explicit consent from users before recording and analyzing their audio and video.

required_integrations: Webinar platforms (e.g., Zoom, GoToWebinar, Webex) via API or SDK integration.
CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) to associate speaker performance data with individual webinars and leads.
Analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) to track user engagement and overall system performance.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 for integration with webinar platforms. JWT for internal API authentication.

technical_specifications.architecture: A microservices architecture with separate services for audio processing, NLP analysis, video analysis (optional), and reporting. A central API gateway manages communication between the frontend and backend services.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes (for storing user profiles, preferences, and aggregated performance data). Consider a NoSQL database like MongoDB for storing unstructured data like transcribed audio.
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob (for storing post-webinar reports and any recorded audio/video data with user consent).
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API (Whisper, fine-tuned BERT), custom ML models (using TensorFlow or PyTorch), OpenCV.
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend services.

API_design: POST /analyze-audio: Accepts an audio stream and returns real-time feedback on pacing, filler words, and clarity.
POST /analyze-video: Accepts a video stream and returns real-time feedback on eye contact (optional).
POST /generate-report: Accepts a webinar ID and speaker ID, generates a post-webinar performance report.
GET /user/settings: Retrieves user-specific settings for feedback sensitivity and data privacy preferences.
frontend_components: Real-time feedback panel: Displays pacing alerts, filler word highlights, and clarity tips.
Webinar controls: Start/stop analysis, adjust feedback sensitivity.
Post-webinar report view: Presents the performance report in a clear and actionable format.
Settings Panel: Allows users to configure their preferences for feedback delivery and data privacy.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, WEBINAR_PLATFORM_API_KEY, ANALYTICS_API_KEY
Vercel deployment: Configure Vercel to automatically deploy the frontend and backend from the GitHub repository. Set the necessary environment variables in the Vercel dashboard.
Build outputs: Frontend: static assets in /public. Backend: serverless functions in /api.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Free (limited features), Basic, Pro, Enterprise.
Usage-based pricing: Charge based on the number of webinars analyzed or the number of speakers using the service.
Add-ons: Premium features like custom branding for reports, advanced analytics, and dedicated support.
customer_segments: Small businesses using webinars for marketing and training.
Mid-market companies with sales teams and customer success organizations.
Enterprises with large-scale training programs and internal communication needs.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: System uptime, API response time, data processing latency.
AI performance KPIs: Accuracy of filler word detection, sentiment analysis accuracy, eye contact detection accuracy.
Adoption/engagement KPIs: Number of active users, frequency of webinar analysis, usage of post-webinar reports, user satisfaction score.
